page.title: 09THE B.P. OIL REFINERY
page.content: B.P. Llandarcy was established as Britain's first oil refinery in 1921. It was expanded in 1960 and had a maximum crude oil throughput of 8 million tonnes per year.Up to 3500 have been employed,falling to 1500 in 1980.Products include Kerosene,petrol, waxes,gases and numerous oils.The crude is imported at Angle Bay,and pumped 62 miles by pipeline to Llandarcy.Most crude comes from the middle east.My father is controller of blending and supplying of all export oils.He calculates blends for quality control.In 1985, competition from other more modern refineries has forced B.P. to reduce capacity.Crude refining will stop,with specialization in other products e.g. kerosene. Unfortunately numbers employed will fall to 350.A sad decline for our first refinery. {Robert Seacombe}
